noun.description: A living organism that feeds on organic matter, typically having specialized sense organs and nervous system and able to respond rapidly to stimuli.
examples: wild animals adapt badly to a caged life
humans are the only animals who weep

adjective.description: Relating to or characteristic of animals.
examples: a wide range of animal species

origin: Middle English: the noun from Latin animal, based on Latin animalis having breath from anima breath; the adjective via Old French from Latin animalis.
